items.title: Trump’s ‘America First’ campaign battle cry gives way to military strikes abroad
items.snippet: President Donald Trump, whose fierce denunciation of military adventurism abroad fueled his unlikely rise to the top of the Republican Party, risks becoming ensnared by that very type of conflict. The ...
items.preview: Trump justified the action as necessary to prevent Iran from obtaining nuclear weapons or developing missiles capable of reaching the US, less than a year after he said airstrikes “obliterated” their capability. US intelligence has also said Iran’s weapons capability was substantially degraded.

items.title: Venezuela attorney general resigns, then lands acting ombudsman role in surprise move
items.snippet: Venezuela’s attorney general, who for years played a central role in the government’s repressive apparatus, resigned Wednesday as pressure grew for ...
items.preview: Tarek William Saab, a close ally of former President Nicolás Maduro, submitted his resignation to the ruling party-controlled National Assembly without offering a reason for his decision. He had held the role of Venezuela’s chief prosecutor since 2017 despite repeated accusations of human rights violations against him and his office.

items.preview: CARACAS, Venezuela (AP) — A special commission of Venezuela’s National Assembly announced Tuesday that over 3,200 people have been fully released since the amnesty law took effect four days ago. This group includes both former detainees and those previously under house arrest or other restrictive measures.

items.title: Colombia’s ELN rebels declare a unilateral ceasefire ahead of key congressional elections
items.snippet: Colombia’s largest remaining rebel group has declared a unilateral ceasefire ahead of next month's congressional elections.
items.preview: Earlier this month, Indigenous Sen. Aida Quilcue was kidnapped while she traveled between two towns in the southwest Cauca region, but was released unharmed a few hours later, as the military deployed troops to rescue her.
